intro: Dalechampia adscendens, commonly known as the ascending dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive veining pattern. The inflorescence consists of cyathia, which are cup-like structures that house the small, inconspicuous flowers.
